Package com.amonson.node_monitoring

Interface NodeMonitoring

public interface NodeMonitoring
This interface is designed to handle one way message passing to multiple nodes in a multi-node cluster of nodes including a heartbeat feature. Implementations of this interface must have a constructor with the following signature: <class_name>(String myHostname, List<String> allHostnames, int port, NodeStateChangeHandler nodeStateChangeHandler, Logger logger, Properties config); See NodeMonitoringFactory for a description of each parameter.

  • Method Details

    • sendMessage

      void sendMessage(Message message)
      A thread safe method to send to one or more nodes on the cluster "network".
      Parameters:
      message - The message object to send as multiple ZeroMQ frames. No message is sent if this node is not already listening for messages.

    • start

      void start(boolean blocking)
      Start listening and allowing sending. If called multiple times subsequent calls are ignored silently.
      Parameters:
      blocking - This method will block if true is passed, otherwise a new thread will be created.

    • stop

      void stop()
      Stop listening and sending, Is ignores silently if the class is not listening.

    • waitForExitWhenOnThread

      void waitForExitWhenOnThread()
      If start is called with a false value for blocking then use this to block until the new thread stops. It will exit immediately if true was used in start.

    • isRunning

      boolean isRunning()
      Get if the monitoring is running.
      Returns:
      true is the monitoring is running; false otherwise.

    • getLogger

      org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Logger getLogger()
      Get the logger.
      Returns:
      The logger used by node monitoring.

    • addOrReplaceMessageHandler

      MessageHandler addOrReplaceMessageHandler(String topic, MessageHandler handler)
      Add or replace an existing topic message handler.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic or key to register for handling. and non-null string with no \0's in the string is valid.
      handler - The callback for an incoming message with the specified topic. This will be called on a thread to protect the communication loop from blocking callbacks. The handler callback should not block for extended periods in any case.
      Returns:
      The old handler or null if there is no previous handler.
      Throws:
      AssertionError - If either of the passed arguments are null.

    • addMessageHandler

      void addMessageHandler(String topic, MessageHandler handler)
      Add a new topic message handler. Will not save the handler is one already exists.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic or key to register for handling. and non-null string with no \0's in the string is valid.
      handler - The callback for an incoming message with the specified topic. This will be called on a thread to protect the communication loop from blocking callbacks. The handler callback should not block for extended periods in any case.
      Throws:
      AssertionError - If either of the passed arguments are null.

    • removeMessageHandler

      MessageHandler removeMessageHandler(String topic)
      Remove a handler for the passed topic.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic to remove the handler for.
      Returns:
      The removed handler if one existed or null of the topic has no handler.
      Throws:
      AssertionError - If the topic is null.

    • addNodeStateChangeHandler

      boolean addNodeStateChangeHandler(NodeStateChangeHandler newHandler)
      Add a new handler for node state change notifications.
      Parameters:
      newHandler - The new handler to add.
      Returns:
      See semantics of List add() method.

    • removeNodeStateChangeHandler

      boolean removeNodeStateChangeHandler(NodeStateChangeHandler newHandler)
      Remove a handler from node state change notifications.
      Parameters:
      newHandler - The handler to remove.
      Returns:
      See semantics of List remove() method.

    • getMyHostname

      String getMyHostname()
      Get the hostname from construction.
      Returns:
      This nodes hostname.
